fields.description:
The Workbox Notification does not display the profile picture of the user in the notification correctly. This is due to the generated URL to the picture does not take into account the context path. For example the correct URL should be 
{{http://localhost:8090/conf51*/download/attachments/1736705/new-93423-pp-meow2.jpg?version=1&modificationDate=1368008626000&api=v2}} 
but the generated URL is {{http://localhost:8090*/download/attachments/1736705/new-93423-pp-meow2.jpg?version=1&modificationDate=1368008626000&api=v2}}

h3.Step to Reproduce
Share a page with 2 or more user.

h3.Expected Result
All user profile picture rendered correctly in the Workbox Notification.

h3.Actual Result
The profile picture of users under the {{Also shared with:}} section is not rendered correctly
!notification.png!
fields.summary: Workbox Notification does not display user profile picture correctly
UI Redressing (Clickjacking)

fields.description:
I've found several XSS in the urls and parameters listed below. The criticality of the issues is moderated since only browsers that perform content sniffing would be affected (e.g. IE7). This limitation comes from the response's Content Type header being set as text/plain. The classical payload <script>alert(1)</script> can be used in all of them as a POC.

XSS locations:
+ https://confluence/rest/tinymce/1/embed/placeholder/image
parameter: contentId

+ https://confluence/rest/tinymce/1/drafts
parameter: draftId and pageId

+ https://confluence/rest/tinymce/1/macro/preview
parameter: name and body

+ https://confluence/rest/tinymce/1/macro/placeholder
parameter: name and contentId

If there's more information required, please let me know and I'll do my best to provide greater details.

Regards,
Adrián
fields.summary: Several XSS flaws in the /rest/tinymce/1

fields.description:
There's a problem described in the following bug report: https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-28111

On most databases the only symptom is just having a null value entry on the sidebar, however when reproducing the same problem with an instance running on Oracle, the sidebar is not configurable anymore, only a spinning wheel is shown that never loads.

!sidebarload.jpeg!

*Steps to reproduce*
# Install Confluence with Oracle DB backend
# Create two spaces
# In one of the spaces click *Configure Sidebar*
# Add a new entry, select *Search* and search for the other space
# Select the space itself _(not the space homepage)_
# Notice that an entry is added as either 'undefined' or 'null'
# Try editing the sidebar again, notice that it is not working

*Workaround*
Open a support ticket at http://support.atlassian.com to verify which entries are to be deleted from the *AO_187CCC_SIDEBAR_LINK* database table. You should only do it after confirmation, but you should look for entries with {{EXTERNAL_LINK}} {{type}} and for those that belong to the offending space key and have an internal URL of your instance defined. The mentioned rows should be only deleted while Confluence is not running.

*Solution*
Do not use space linking and wait for the solution in [https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-28111] to fix this functionality
fields.summary: Sidebar linking to Space will break 'Configure Sidebar' function on Oracle

fields.description:
Refer to: https://ecosystem.atlassian.net/browse/STRM-2137

Steps to reproduce:
1. Create app link between JIRA and Confluence 
2. Add Confluence activity stream gadget to JIRA dashboard
3. Add a new page in Confluence.
4. Insert an image in new page, resize it and save.
5. Refresh Confluence activity stream on JIRA dashboard.
6. Confluence add 2 updates to activity stream for the new page. Latest states an attachment is added, with picture of image. Latest, but one, states new page is added with broken image icon.

Expected Behaviour:
Both images should be rendered fine.

Analysis
Check image location of the 2 images from recent activity. Attachment one is complete url to image in /download/attachments. Page one is relative url to image in /download/thumbnails and is not rendered fine as JIRA tries to resolve it with JIRA base url.

DefaultAttachedImageResourceMarshaller in Confluence does not prepend base url to thumbnail images resulting in broken link in activity stream.
fields.summary: Confluence thumbnails do not render in JIRA activity stream

fields.description: After removing a user from membership in the confluence-administrator group, the user still is listed as a member of the group when viewed from the Group Members administration page. However, in the Edit User Groups page for the user, the user is no longer a member of the confluence-administrator group. The user is not able to exercise confluence-administrator level actions, so it appears the system understands the user is no longer a confluence-administrator. The problem is that the user still appears as a member of confluence-administrators in the Group Members administration page. This page should reflect the actual group membership.  During a review of security for our site, we need to show appropriate group memberships and this bug makes it difficult to do that.
fields.summary: Group Members admin page not showing memberships correctly

fields.description:
When you try to create a page without a title, an error message is displayed:
!title_null.jpeg!

However, this error message persists even if you have entered a title properly, then press *Preview*. 

*Steps to reproduce*
# Create a page, enter content but no title
# Press *Save* (error message displayed as expected)
# Enter any title
# Press *Preview* (the error message persists)
# Press *Edit* (the error is still there)

*Expected behavior:* the error should disappear once it is not relevant anymore.
fields.summary: 'A title must be specified' error message persists on the Preview mode
Documentation request: changing build number in exportDescriptor.properties

fields.description:
Description.
The Anonymous Access permission in the space should not affect normal Confluence user but actually once Anonymous Access permission  is enable, all the user will have those permission in the space as well.

h3. Step to Reproduce
# Create a space.
# Go to Space Tools >> Permissions
# Remove all the group in the Group Permission
# Edit the Anonymous Access >> Select All >> Save all
# Go to Confluence Admin >> Edit Permissions >> disable Can Use Permission Under *Anonymous Access*.

h3.Expected Result
# The space can only be access by user that have been given permission.

h3.Actual Result
# All the authenticated user in Confluence is able to access the space.
fields.summary: Space that allow  Anoymous Access  can be accessed by all User

fields.description:
When a Crowd User Directory is set up to have a password regex and then linked to Confluence, no feedback is given at all when attempting to create a new user via email invitation or via self-signup, and if you attempt to change an existing users password to something that doesn't meet the regex you are given a stacktrace.

*Steps to Reproduce:*

# Configure a Crowd directory to have a password regex (under the configuration tab)
# Set up Confluence to have this Crowd directory at the top of your directories list, so users are added to this directory upon creation
# Allow for self-signup or email a user invitation
# Note that if you attempt to create an account which fails the password regex, absolutely no feedback is given. An error is shown in the logs, however.
# Alternatively, create a user with a valid password, then attempt to change that password for the user. This will result in the following:
!Screen Shot 2013-05-07 at 1.58.43 PM.png|width=1200!



*Notes:* 
# If you attempt to add a user via 'Add a User', you *are* given an error message (which reads 'The following error(s) occurred: Failed to create the user 'disabler'. Check your server logs for more information.')
# If the user changes their own password, they are shown the following error message: 'The new password you entered is invalid.'
fields.summary: When a password regex is used in a Crowd Directory, no feedback is given when attempting to create/change a password in Confluence.

Kind regards,

fields.summary: The Confluence JSON-RPC API does not work with some built-in Confluence Remote API methods

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-29200].
  {panel}

In a Confluence page, I want to embed a JIRA issues macro in an Expand macro, and display it in dynamic mode.

I have managed to do this on one page, but then when I repeated the action on another page, with a different filter, the issues list displayed blank. When changing to static mode it displayed ok.

I copied the first macro to the second page and it worked fine. The two macros have almost identical filtes, based on an Epic with status not in resolved or closed, and sorted by one column.

This one worked:
https://emarsys.jira.com/sr/jira.issueviews:searchrequest-rss/temp/SearchRequest.xml?jqlQuery=%22Epic+Link%22+%3D+%22DMX+Austria%22+and+status+not+in+%28closed%2C+resolved%29+ORDER+BY+due+ASC&tempMax=1000

This one did not:
https://emarsys.jira.com/sr/jira.issueviews:searchrequest-rss/temp/SearchRequest.xml?jqlQuery=%22Epic+Link%22+%3D+%2272GTM%22+AND+status+not+in+%28closed%2C+resolved%29+ORDER+BY+priority+DESC&tempMax=1000


This ticket created after receiving a reply from by Mick Nassette to a question (ID: 165602)
fields.summary: JIRA Issues macro sometimes will not display in Dynamic mode
Cancel the comment editor without a page load

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:
1. Create a new page
2. Insert some headings and apply additional formatting to those headings (e.g. make some bold, underlined, etc.) - the formatting won't appear on the headings (this is desired behaviour)
3. Insert a table of contents

You'll find that the links in the table of contents will bold, underlined, etc. based on the heading formatting.
fields.summary: Table of contents (TOC) displays formatting of headings it includes
Mobile view doesn't show last edit date

fields.description:
The editor has a bug where elements like headings and paragraph stop being headings and paragraph semantically, but retain their styling. This breaks, among other things, the ToC macro.

How to reproduce (in Chrome):

# Create a page. Put two headings and two paragraphs in it, in this order:
{noformat}
Heading A
Paragraph A
Paragraph B
Heading B
{noformat}
# Delete the line break between Heading A and Paragraph A. Also, delete the line break between Paragraph B and Heading B, like so:
{noformat}
Heading AParagraph A
Paragraph BHeading B
{noformat}
# The whole first line will now be marked as a heading, but the second half of it will be styled like paragraph text. Also, the whole second line will be marked as a paragraph, but the second half of it will be styled like heading text.
fields.summary: Editor creates elements that are only styled like headings or paragraphs

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
*NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-29189].
{panel}
h2. Steps to reproduce.
 # Add a JIRA pie chart gadget (or any other gadget) on a Confluence page
 # Export the page to PDF or Word.
 # The chart is not rendered. You see html markup being displayed in the export (refer attachment)

Tested with JIRA 5.2.1 / 6.3.3 and Confluence 5.1.2 / 5.5.6.

h2. Workaround

You can print the page with your browser and then select "Save as PDF" instead of actually printing the page. This is because the problem is related to the PDF export library that is unable to render the JS code of the gadgets before triggering the export. When you print the page in the browser, the content is already rendered, so there is no need for a server-side action before generating the export.
fields.summary: PDF/Word export of gadget from JIRA renders html markup

fields.description:
In the Application Links Page when trying to configure an application link, the Incoming Authentication Section is missing the button to Apply the changes so it is not possible to create/ save the Application Link details as the box is truncated.

The problem seems to occur with JDK 1.6. After upgrading to JDK 1.7 and clearing plugin cache, the problem seems to go away.
fields.summary: Missing apply button in Incoming Authentication in Application Links

fields.description:
h3. Steps to reproduce:

# Create a page using quotes between the title. In Example: This is a "Page with Quotes"
# Click on _Insert > Other Macros > Anchor_, give the anchor a name. e.g: Example
# Through the page, insert a link to the Anchor by _Insert > Link > Advanced_ and type the name of the Anchor that you gave to this Anchor. eg: #Example
# Save the page
# Click on the Link to the Anchor

The Anchor function will not work. Instead of the link guide you to the Anchor, nothing will happens;

h3. Workaround

Remove the quotes from the title.
fields.summary: Anchor Macro Feature doesn't Work with "Quotes" in the Title of the Page
Widget Connector Macro documentation should list unsupported Google Docs formats

fields.description:
h4. Steps to Reproduce
# Create some heading with german umlauts (eg:Büro)
# Create a table of content and in {{Exclude Headings}} field add the regular expression to exclude heading with the umlaut characters(eg:Büro).

h4. Expected Results
The Table of Content should exclude the heading with the umlaut characters

h4. Actual Results
The heading  with umlaut characters is still displayed in the Table of Content
This bug occurs with {{Include Headings}} as well.
!toc_umlaut.png!
fields.summary: Table of Content does not exclude or include Heading with german Umlaut

fields.description:
Application links have both an application URL, the URL by which the app connects on the backend (eg. http://jira.localhost), and a "display URL", the link displayed to the user (eg. https://jira.company.com").

Currently this doesn't work with the jiraissues macro, because:
- If I use the "application URL" parameter (eg. "http://jira.localhost/sr/..."), I get results, but *the hyperlink of the search is then wrong*.
- If, as a workaround, I try to use the "display URL",  I get an message telling me "This table displays contents from an external source. The contents will be displayed as HTML. If you trust the security of this source, you can display the original formatting and avoid this warning by creating an Application Link to this JIRA instance".

As for fixing this, I suggest: when rendering the search link, examine the search XML URL, and if it begins with an applink URL, substitute the applink's display URL.
fields.summary: JIRA Issues macro links to application URL rather than display URL - the search link uses the application URL.

fields.description:
If you write a JQL query that is too long and share it with an user that has Confluence access too and your JIRA and Confluence instances are sharing their notifications ([https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Configuring+Workbox+Notifications]), then Confluence will fail to retrieve that notification to the {{AO_9412A1_AONOTIFICATION}} table due to column length.

*You will see the following stack trace in your logs when using MySQL:*
{noformat}...
Caused by: com.mysql.jdbc.MysqlDataTruncation: Data truncation: Data too long for column 'GLOBAL_ID' at row 1
        at com.mysql.jdbc.MysqlIO.checkErrorPacket(MysqlIO.java:3561)
        at com.mysql.jdbc.MysqlIO.checkErrorPacket(MysqlIO.java:3495)
        at com.mysql.jdbc.MysqlIO.sendCommand(MysqlIO.java:1959)
        at com.mysql.jdbc.MysqlIO.sqlQueryDirect(MysqlIO.java:2113)
        at com.mysql.jdbc.ConnectionImpl.execSQL(ConnectionImpl.java:2693)
        at com.mysql.jdbc.PreparedStatement.executeInternal(PreparedStatement.java:2102)
        at com.mysql.jdbc.PreparedStatement.executeUpdate(PreparedStatement.java:2395)
        at com.mysql.jdbc.PreparedStatement.executeUpdate(PreparedStatement.java:2313)
        at com.mysql.jdbc.PreparedStatement.executeUpdate(PreparedStatement.java:2298)
        at com.mchange.v2.c3p0.impl.NewProxyPreparedStatement.executeUpdate(NewProxyPreparedStatement.java:105)
        at net.java.ao.EntityProxy.save(EntityProxy.java:278)
        at net.java.ao.EntityProxy.invoke(EntityProxy.java:119)
        ... 275 more
{noformat}

*The following on Oracle:*
{noformat}
Caused by: java.sql.SQLException: ORA-12899: value too large for column "CONFLUENCE_4_3_7"."AO_9412A1_AONOTIFICATION"."GLOBAL_ID" (actual: 454, maximum: 255)

	at oracle.jdbc.driver.T4CTTIoer.processError(T4CTTIoer.java:445)
	at oracle.jdbc.driver.T4CTTIoer.processError(T4CTTIoer.java:396)
	at oracle.jdbc.driver.T4C8Oall.processError(T4C8Oall.java:879)
	at oracle.jdbc.driver.T4CTTIfun.receive(T4CTTIfun.java:450)
	at oracle.jdbc.driver.T4CTTIfun.doRPC(T4CTTIfun.java:192)
	at oracle.jdbc.driver.T4C8Oall.doOALL(T4C8Oall.java:531)
	at oracle.jdbc.driver.T4CPreparedStatement.doOall8(T4CPreparedStatement.java:207)
	at oracle.jdbc.driver.T4CPreparedStatement.executeForRows(T4CPreparedStatement.java:1044)
	at oracle.jdbc.driver.OracleStatement.doExecuteWithTimeout(OracleStatement.java:1329)
	at oracle.jdbc.driver.OraclePreparedStatement.executeInternal(OraclePreparedStatement.java:3584)
	at oracle.jdbc.driver.OraclePreparedStatement.executeUpdate(OraclePreparedStatement.java:3665)
	at oracle.jdbc.driver.OraclePreparedStatementWrapper.executeUpdate(OraclePreparedStatementWrapper.java:1352)
	at com.mchange.v2.c3p0.impl.NewProxyPreparedStatement.executeUpdate(NewProxyPreparedStatement.java:105)
	at net.java.ao.EntityProxy.save(EntityProxy.java:278)
	at net.java.ao.EntityProxy.invoke(EntityProxy.java:119)
	... 231 more{noformat}

*Steps to reproduce*
# Link Confluence and JIRA together with trusted application link
# Set up common user management, so that you will use JIRA as user directory
# Create two users *user1* and *user2*, being part of {{confluence-users}} group
# Create a project in JIRA
# Write a JQL in JIRA that contains quite some elements (my example was: {{?jql=project%20%3D%20csike%20and%20issuetype%20in%20(Bug%2CImprovement%2C"New%20Feature"%2CSub-task%2CTask)%20and%20created%20>%20endOfDay()%20and%20description%20~%20'whatever'%20and%20affectedVersion%20is%20EMPTY}}
# Share this using the share button (you will need to have mail server configured on JIRA end) with *user2* when you are logged in as *user1*

Expected result: Workbox Notification displayed on Confluence
Actual result: No notification displayed, only email received, stack trace above found in the logs

*Workaround*
Save the JQL results as a filter and share the filter instead.

You need to restart JIRA to get rid of the notification triggered, so that JIRA will remove it from its caches.
fields.summary: Confluence - JIRA Workbox notifications fail when sharing a long JQL result
Add metadata info for attachments

fields.description:
After the recent upgrade to Confluence 5.1, the Recent Activity Macro does not output reverse chronological information.  This is evident through either the dashboard macro or the macro inserted on any existing page.

Hoping that this was an indexing issue due to the upgrade, we have attempted to re-index.  This did not solve our problem.

We also attempted updating a page - The page update now shows at the top of the recent activity list, but did not flush/address changes prior to the 5.1 upgrade.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-29166].
  {panel}

Deleting a previous revision of a blog post requires permission as a 'Space Administrator', even with the permission, deletion is not permitted.

+Reproduction:+
* Create a new blog post
* Make a revision of the post

+Expected Behaviour:+
* Access 'Tools' > 'Space History'
* Check previous revision
* Select 'Delete'
* Previous revision is added to trash and can either be purged or restored by space administrator

+Current Behaviour:+
* Access 'Tools' > 'Space History'
* Check previous revision
* Select 'Delete'
* Receive message "Not Permitted, You are not permitted to perform this operation"

Users are unable to delete blog histories and hit into *Not Permitted, You are not permitted to perform this operation.*

+Workaround:+ 
(Available for Confluence Server)
* Delete the page previous versions, and set the current version as "V.1" from the database
* Guide is available from the documentation: [How to Remove all Previous Versions of a Page Manually in the Database Using SQL Commands|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CONFKB/How+to+Remove+all+Previous+Versions+of+a+Page+Manually+in+the+Database+Using+SQL+Commands]
fields.summary: Unable to delete blog version

fields.description:
If you add a JIRA issues macro to a page which has the table of contents (TOC) macro, and, in the JIRA issues macro parameters, you set the style to _static_, the TOC macro displays an entry for the JIRA Issues macro.

The problem is that the text in the JIRA macro is marked as a header (<h2>). The problem only appears once you save the page. It is displayed properly in the preview.

Reproduced with the JIRA macros plugin 4.0.29. It is not a problem in version 4.0.17.

+Workaround:+

Add the titles you do not want to display in the field _Exclude Headings_ of the Table of Contents macro.
fields.summary: JIRA Issues Macro in static style is displayed in the TOC macro

fields.description:
h3.Steps to Reproduce
Create a space and add 2000+ watchers to it. Enable page profiling and after that, try to create a page or publish a blog post. Notice that the page creation and blog post publish can take a long time (sometimes even 200+ seconds) . In the profiling logs you will see thousands of these:
{code}
[0ms] - Parse: templates/email/html/includes/header.vm
            [0ms] - Parse: templates/email/html/includes/header-styles.vm
            [0ms] - Parse: templates/email/html/includes/header-body-start.vm
            [0ms] - Parse: templates/email/html/includes/title.vm
          [0ms] - Parse: templates/email/html/includes/footer-links.vm
          [0ms] - Parse: templates/email/html/includes/footer.vm
        [14ms] - UserAccessor.getUser()
        [0ms] - UserAccessor.isDeactivated()
        [66ms] - PermissionManager.hasPermissionNoExemptions()
          [31ms] - UserAccessor.hasMembership()
          [24ms] - DefaultSpacePermissionManager.hasPermission(USECONFLUENCE, test@test.com, global)
            [0ms] - UserAccessor.isDeactivated()
            [0ms] - UserAccessor.getGroup()
            [0ms] - UserAccessor.hasMembership()
            [0ms] - UserAccessor.getGroup()
            [1ms] - UserAccessor.hasMembership()
          [0ms] - UserAccessor.hasMembership()
          [11ms] - DefaultSpacePermissionManager.hasPermission(VIEWSPACE, test@test.com, it)
            [1ms] - UserAccessor.getGroup()
            [0ms] - UserAccessor.hasMembership()
            [0ms] - UserAccessor.getGroup()
            [0ms] - UserAccessor.hasMembership()
        [22ms] - UserAccessor.getConfluenceUserPreferences()
        [0ms] - UserAccessor.getPropertySet()
        [0ms] - UserAccessor.getUser()
        [0ms] - UserAccessor.getPropertySet()
        [0ms] - FormatSettingsManager.getDateFormat()
        [0ms] - FormatSettingsManager.getDateTimeFormat()
        [0ms] - FormatSettingsManager.getTimeFormat()
        [0ms] - FormatSettingsManager.getDateFormat()
        [0ms] - FormatSettingsManager.getDateTimeFormat()
        [0ms] - FormatSettingsManager.getEditorBlogPostDate()
        [12ms] - LikeManager.hasLike()
        [12ms] - PermissionManager.hasCreatePermission()
          [0ms] - UserAccessor.hasMembership()
          [0ms] - UserAccessor.hasMembership()
          [11ms] - DefaultSpacePermissionManager.hasPermission(COMMENT, test@test.com, it)
            [0ms] - UserAccessor.getGroup()
            [0ms] - UserAccessor.hasMembership()
            [0ms] - UserAccessor.getGroup()
            [0ms] - UserAccessor.hasMembership()
        [1ms] - Rendering velocity template: /styles/default-inline-css.vm
          [0ms] - Parse: /styles/colors-css.vm
            [0ms] - Parse: /styles/aui-overrides-css.vm
            [0ms] - Parse: /styles/labels-css.vm
            [0ms] - Parse: /styles/diffs-css.vm
        [3ms] - Rendering velocity template: /templates/email/html/page-added-notification.vm
          [0ms] - Parse: templates/email/html/includes/constants.vm
          [0ms] - PermissionManager.hasCreatePermission()
{code}

So permission checks for *all notified users* of the page creation or change seems to be the culprit here. Suggest that we perform the permission checks during the mail queue flush, rather than the page creation process. In the example above, the 3 permission checks (USECONFLUENCE, VIEWSPACE and COMMENT) comes up to 24ms + 11ms + 11ms = 46ms for a single user (permission checks only). Multiply that by 2000 users, and you get a 92 second wait to complete the page creation.
fields.summary: Permission checks for Notifications slows down page operations

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-29162].
  {panel}

h4. Steps to reproduce
# Open the template editor
# Insert a code macro
# Insert a template variable into the code macro
# Save the template
# Create a page from the template

The user will not be prompted to insert a value for the variable.
In addition, if they attempt to edit the template, the variable will also have disappeared.

We should either allow the template variables to function inside code macros as they if they weren't inside the code macro. Or we should at least not allow template variables to be inserted into code macros.

Pre 4.3 (before we revamped page templates / template variables) template variables could be used in code macros but ONLY if the template variables was repeated somewhere else on the page outside a code macro. So even before this template variables in code macros did not work that great.
fields.summary: template variables cannot be used in code macros

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa} *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-29161]. {panel} Note to Atlassians: PLEASE do not change the text here to leave out vital detail, it clearly causes confusion among your own staff!... When editing a page and creating a link to what should become a new page you no longer get the choice to create that page from a template. This was possible in the old editor. (Insert link to Create Page) NOTE: This is a clone of CONF-23884, which you claim to have solved with the *Create from Template Macro* but that macro has nothing to do with this issue. It doesn't even come close to cover it or providing a workaround. The workflow requested here is what you could do in 3.X. Workflow: 1. Edit Page 2. Type: [somelink 3. Select "Insert link to create page" 4. Save 5. Click link 6. Here I would like to be able to select a template! ---- Since the link is already treated in a special way linking to e.g.: {code} http://wiki/pages/createpage.action?spaceKey=x&title=Link+Here&linkCreation=true&fromPageId=12820509 {code} I think this could be solved very easy by rendering a dropdown with the same to options as you have under "Add"... The other link being: {code} http://wiki/pages/createpage-choosetemplate.action?spaceKey=x&newSpaceKey=x&fromPageId=12820509 {code} So instead of rendering the following: {code:language=html} Link Here {code} you could maybe render something like: {code:language=html}
Link Here that is very very very long long long
Create Blank Page Create from Template
{code} The onclick is just an example of how it could be under jQuery, obviously the formatting is ugly here, but it shows that it could properly be done fairly simple... The "createpage-choosetemplate.action" with title works. Or HELL!!!.... Just render: {code:language=html} Link Here [Select Template] {code} ---- The important thing is: * You get to choose the template when you choose to create the page, rather than being dictated by the one inserting a macro. * The link turns into a real page link after and can no longer be used to create additional new pages

fields.description:
If I Confluence 4.2 you create a table with the headers in a column instead than in a row, from Confluence 4.3, some elements of the header lose part of the formatting. The problem is caused because the XHTML code of the table uses the tag {{td}} instead than {{th}} for that content. To format it in Confluence 4.2 it uses the class _highlight_ (or _nohighlight_ for the tag ), but the CSS for that class in Confluence 4.3 and later has changed and no longer uses bold letter. Code for the page: {code}
header 1 content 1
header 2 content 2
{code} In Confluence 4.3, the highlighted cells use a {{th}} tag, but there are no migration task to update existing tables from previous versions. +Workaround:+ You can modify the content directly in the database. Here is an example for Oracle Database. You may need to adapt these queries to work your database server. # Shutdown Confluence. # Run the following queries: (!) This will modify your database. Please make sure you have a database backup before you run these queries: {code:sql}UPDATE bodycontent SET body = REGEXP_REPLACE(body, '', '') WHERE contentid IN ( SELECT contentid FROM content WHERE prevver IS NULL AND contenttype IN ('PAGE','BLOGSPOT') AND content_status='current'); UPDATE bodycontent SET body = REGEXP_REPLACE(body, '', '') WHERE contentid IN ( SELECT contentid FROM content WHERE prevver IS NULL AND contenttype IN ('PAGE','BLOGSPOT') AND content_status='current');{code} # Start Confluence.
fields.summary: Use a column as the header of a table loses format after upgrade

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-29144].
  {panel}

If a user receives a direct link to a file on Confluence, they used to be asked to log in, and were then redirected to the file.

However, since 5.1-OD-5, the redirect instead sends the user to a 'This action is not permitted' page after being logged in.

The login screen will direct to {{login.action?os_destination=%2Fnotpermitted.action%3Fversion%3D1%26modificationDate%3D1366730801169%26api%3Dv2}}, instead of {{login?dest-url=%2Fwiki%2Fdownload%2Fattachments%2F622598%2Ffilename%3Fapi%3Dv2}}

This prevents users from opening files easily from their email notifications.

*Steps to reproduce*
In a default Confluence instance.
* Create a new Space and File list
* Upload a file
* Once uploaded, copy the link URL to the file.
* Log out
* Paste the link in your browser
** _You will be asked to log in_
* Log in, and you will see 'Action not permitted'



Note:
Able to replicate with *'user logged in initially'* in Confluence version 5.3.4.
fields.summary: Directly being linked to an attachment before logging in will redirect to a 'action not permitted' message

fields.description:
When you create an Application Link to another instance, Confluence will populate the Application Navigator automatically using the Application URL.

This creates a problem when the App URL is an internal reference to a system, such as http://localhost:port.  Confluence may be able to contact the application with that URL, but the user cannot, and will most likely see a site unreachable message.

It should instead scrape the Display URL of the App Link to create the Application Navigator link.

h3. Workaround
# Hide the existing JIRA App Nav entry using the Hide checkbox.
# Click Manage in the JIRA App Nav entry, which should take you to your JIRA Admin console.
# From here, you can add a new Application using the desired URL.
fields.summary: Application Navigator uses Application URL instead of Display URL from Application Link

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-29137].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Edit in Office permissions are currently set via giving a user Page Add permission. While this made sense when Confluence used the View File macro to embed Office content into a Confluence page - and thus editing the Office document was essentially the same as editing the page - it does not hold true anymore. The new File Preview experience clearly emphasizes the fact that Office documents are attachments, and it can be confusing to set Page Add permissions for operations involving attachments.

h3. Suggested Solution
Change the permissions scheme used for Edit in Office to check against Attachment Add instead of Page Add.
fields.summary: Add the ability to configure the Edit in Office permission

fields.description:
*Problem Description*
If you put image under panel macro, and if the image resolution is bigger than your screen, the screen won't be vertically scrollable, despite it can be horizontally scrollable. This issue could be caused by the stylesheet rule where overflow was not allowed.

*Steps to reproduce*
# Get a huge resolution sample image.
# In Confluence, go to editor.
# Click _Insert >> Other Macros_.
# Choose Panel macro and insert it to page.
# On the panel macro body, insert the image with original resolution.
# Save the page and notice that the image won't be vertically scrollable.

*Workaround*
# Navigate to _Confluence Admin >> Stylesheets_.
# Put the following code in the stylesheet field.
{code}
.panel {
    overflow: scroll;
}
{code}
# Hit _Save_ button
fields.summary: Image with resolution bigger than your screen under panel macro won't be vertically scrollable

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-29130].
  {panel}

Currently, the macro allows custom titles, which is good!

But, the title style is locked at H2, which is limiting.

See this page: https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/STASH/Stash+upgrade+guide

In this case, to have the TOC macro display the "Upgrading to Stash x.x" items, without the "Known issues" headings, the former headings have to be made H3, and the TOC macro set to ignore H2.

This achieves a useful TOC, but mucks with the heading levels of the page... what is needed here is to be able to set the JIRA issues macro title to H3 or H4.

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
It appears the H2 heading is only locked when the JIRA issues macro is being to Static style.
When set to Dynamic, the title will take over the heading as used within the macro itself.
Additionally, when set to static, the title appears to fall outside of the macro window, where as it stays inside when set to dynamic.
The issues-subheading class is set to H2, so custom css will not provide a solution here.
This has been tested with version 4.0.29 of the JIRA Issues Macro.
The version 4.0.17 does not appear to show this behavior
fields.summary: Please provide a way to set the title font size/style for the JIRA issues macro
